organisation_name: Association for automatic identification and mobility Europe (AIM EUROPE VZW)
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
goals__remit:
AIM EUROPE VZW is an association of producers, suppliers, distributors, end users and other strategic partners with the primary objective of promoting the development and use of Automatic identification and data capture (AIDC) technology and services in Europe. 
To establish managing, developing and promoting the interests of the automatic identification and data collecting sector it makes use of RAIN RFID technology. RAIN RFID is a committee of AIM global and is an alliance promoting the universal adoption of UHF RFID Technology in a way similar to other wireless technology organizations including NFC Forum, WiFi Alliance and Bluetooth SIG. RAIN uses the GS1 UHF Gen 2 protocol which is ISO/IEC has standardized as 18000-63. The word RAIN - an acronym derived from Radio frequency IdentificatioN – is intended as a nod to the link between UHF RFID and the cloud, where RFID-based data can be stored, managed and shared via the internet. A RAIN RFID solution uses a reader to read and write a tagged item, manage the data and take action.
relevant_communication:
1) Implementation of the Radio Equipment Directive (RED)  
    2014/53/EU 
2) Short Range Device Decision 2013/752/EU 
3) ElectroMagnetic Compatibility Directive 2014/30/EU 
4) Low Voltage Directive  2014/35/EU 
5) Electromagnetic Fields Directive 2013/35/EU 
6) Council Recommendation on the limitation of exposure  
    of the general public to electromagnetic fields (0 Hz to  
    300 GHz) 1999/519/EC 
7) Participation in EU structures and platforms.
